Yes, another thing that a pregnant woman or man might ask a medical chatbot is for information on whether they are at risk of developing gestational diabetes during their pregnancy. Gestational diabetes is a type of high blood sugar disorder that may affect women who become pregnant and usually develops between the 24th week of pregnancy up until delivery. Symptoms of gestational diabetes include frequent urination or feeling unusually thirsty, frequent infections, nausea and vomiting that doesn't improve after the first trimester, increased vaginal dryness over time, and baby ultrasound confirmation of macrosomia (high birth weight). Women who develop gestational diabetes should monitor their blood glucose levels regularly, follow lifestyle changes, and attend prenatal appointments with their healthcare provider. If left untreated, gestational diabetes can lead to complications both for the mother and the baby.
